website_summaries.verdict: This MSI desktop computer provides an excellent choice for both consumers and business professionals.
pros: Simple to mount to a wall or use in combination with an HDTV
Offers lots of ports to connect the computer to your USB devices
Curved edges and smooth surface give the computer a streamlined look and feel
Modular design ensures you can instantly upgrade your computer at your convenience
Supports both high-definition and 4K ultra high-definition content
cons: Not compatible with all types of memory upgrades
Cannot be used in conjunction with Windows 7

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. Modest numbers behind it, but coupled with a decent amount of ram and a good drive, it's a good performer. I'm really curious why they package the drivers on a CD though, for a PC that has no way of connecting to a CD drive unless you buy/have an external one. Since the drivers for the wifi adapter are on that very disc, you need to either have a second computer (with a disc drive) and usb drive handy, or a wired internet connection to download them yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Did not even turn on
customer_reviews.text: Pressed the power, and nothing.. Power led did not light up, and fan didn't spin. The build quality is very questionable. The bottom plate did not fit well, and the USB port in the front did not align correctly.. Returned, then bought the Gigabyte Brix. Night and day in terms of build quality (Not to mention it actually turns on) I own high end MSI motherboards and graphic cards with no issues, but they messed up on this product...
customer_reviews.author: Samaritan

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful solid little system
customer_reviews.text: Small compact, looks beautiful and feels really solid. I bought this system to run as a headless server running Xubuntu 16.04.1. I added the following components; - 2x 4GB RAM Kingston KVR16LS11/4 (make sure you use MSi approved RAM). - 1x Kingston SSDNow UV400 2.5" 240GB SATA III TLC Internal Solid State Drive (SSD) You can boot from the SSD drive (despite some people saying you can't). Setup is very easy. My unit runs 24/7 and so far has been rock solid. Performance has been good, but have not really pushed this little system to its limits, as I main use it for programming and running MySQL server.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Boelema

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little machine!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a little powerhouse! I equipped mine with 8GB DDR4 RAM and a 128GB M.2 SSD. I am running OpenSUSE Tumbleweed Linux on it and it works great! The i5-7200U is a dual-core, hyper-threaded CPU with good performance and low power usage. I use this for web browsing (I tend to have lots of tabs (10-15) and multiple web browsers open at the same time), videos play great (Youtube, Netflix, Plex), I have absolutely no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Joslin

customer_reviews.title: Fast and small
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a very nice little machine, surprisingly fast. I am one of the suckers that is using a 2.5in SATA drive instead of mSATA but I did get the cable to work after some time. I would not recommend it to a layman, it connects 180 degress from how you think it should connect. Pay close attention to the quickstart diagram. It would not boot of an older ADATA SSD I had laying around despite recognizing it as a boot device, but it did boot off a a Samsung 850EVO SSD. I am using Crucial memory SODIMM and has no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept. Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping to use it as a general computing machine. Email, work, surf the web, etc. I intended to use it with Linux, and stream games via Steam from my current computer, so I could only need to turn it on for gaming related tasks, or other tasks I could not do from Linux. I tried both Linux distributions and Windows, and in both cases the CPU would randomly hiccup. It's almost like it couldn't handle the load, you start doing something and you get micro-stutters / freezes. I was really surprised it was happening in Linux as well but if I went for another small PC like this I would likely go for an i5 minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Classic Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Accepts only certain RAM
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little PC once you get it working... I did have problems with getting it to recognize a Samsung 840 Pro 120GB SSD, so I ended up using a leftover 1 TB 2.5" drive from my laptop SSD conversion instead. Also, the Amazon recommended Crucial RAM did not work at all and I had to return it. The RAM that does work is this one: "Kingston HyperX Impact Black 8GB Kit (2x4GB) 1600MHz DDR3L CL9 SODIMM 1.35V Laptop Memory (HX316LS9IBK2/8)" With the right RAM installed and the right Hard Drive, this PC is great. My daughter is using it as her main PC now.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: Update 2016-07-07: I'm changing the 5 stars to only 4 because there is a malfunction with the hardware using a cable from mini displayport to displayport. Only works if I'm using an adapter from mini DP to DP, then using a cable with DP in both sides, or using another type of adapter, for example from mini DP to DVI (see image). I contacted the MSI support and they told me that there is a malfunction with the hardware itself, is not the cable, because I tested with 2 different cable and different brands. That is my only complain.
customer_reviews.author: Ezequiel

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I paired my i7 cubi with a 250gb mSATA solid state drive and 16gb of RAM, all by Crucial and it cold boots windows 8.1 in about 8 seconds. I only have chrome installed so far, but I'm happy with this machine so far. The sleep function works perfectly, it's very quiet, has plenty of features, and uses an absurdly low amount of electricity. It's not ever going to be capable of being a hard core gaming rig, and probably can't handle 3d imaging software, but for the average, non-specialized user I'd have no problem recommending this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jenkins C. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Use it to manage by Pi-Hole Server / FTP Manager ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it to manage by Pi-Hole Server / FTP Manager / Ubiquity Wifi Manager / and any other needs. Loaded her up with 8 gigs of ram / 64 GB SSD / and a 1 TB Drive as my download manager. Runs 24/7 days a week. I am running Ubuntu Mate 16.04 on it.
customer_reviews.author: dsngjoe

customer_reviews.title: Good little box for the money, just add memory and hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Great little box, if you accept it for what it is. It's not a powerhouse, just a small, affordable little PC for basic tasks. I put 4GB of RAM and a 120GB mSATA drive in this. Windows 10 runs quickly and smoothly, and so far it has done a great job as a little media PC hooked up to my TV. It's not going to run the latest 3D games, but it I wouldn't really expect it to with the integrated Intel graphics. The only downside I've seen so far is that it can get pretty warm
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but, as others have mentioned
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but, as others have mentioned, the bottom panel is definitely much more difficult to deal with that it seems like it should be. 2 of the screws were nearly stripped completely but luckily I was able to get them out. I was able to install Ubuntu and have a couple of USB drives attached and a wireless keyboard & mouse. It's only been running about 18 hours so far but so far it's been able to keep up with anything I have tried to do. Definitely have a wired usb keyboard for the initial setup.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peeples

customer_reviews.title: This computer is pretty powerful once you get everything installed into it
customer_reviews.text: This computer is pretty powerful once you get everything installed into it. It's not gonna be a console killer or anything, but it'll be great at downloading things or streaming video or games. I installed Ubuntu Linux on it, and it performed near flawlessly. I've only had one real issue with it. While it does have two slots for SODIMM ram sticks, it didn't even try to boot with two in. However, it booted just fine with one in. Maybe I can find some workaround for that, but right now it works just fine with one.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Runs cool
customer_reviews.text: Great nano PC to run security camera monitoring software. Software pull about a 25-30% CPU load and unit stays cool.
customer_reviews.author: John Holsenbeck Jr

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, fast, and runs my media server without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Bernard

customer_reviews.title: I like the unit and it does as expected
customer_reviews.text: I like the unit and it does as expected. The only thing I wish is that the manufacturer had recommended a Solid State drive. I installed a conventional hard drive and broke on my second trip with the unit. Also when you install a hard drive make sure you have some double sticking tape or felt handy. The unit does not have any mounting brackets for the hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Herm

customer_reviews.title: Great little system
customer_reviews.text: Great little system. Purchased to be a small quiet Linux system. First delivered system was DOA. The second system required a BIOS update to 850 to allow for 16 GB of RAM. Without the BIOS update, you're stuck with a maximum of 8 GB. Purchased with: 1) Samsung 850 EVO 500 GB mSATA 2-Inch SSD (MZ-M5E500BW) 2) Kingston HyperX Impact Black 16GB Kit (2x8GB) 1600MHz DDR3L CL9 SODIMM 1.35V Laptop Memory (HX316LS9IBK2/16)
customer_reviews.author: Kawazu

customer_reviews.title: Great price good performance.
customer_reviews.text: Installed with a 2.5" 240GB SSD. Windows 10 Pro. Installed cleanly and with the 3160 Celeron it's quite zippy. Running it with Microsoft Hyper-V and an Ubuntu virtual machine all in 4GB of RAM (Crucial). Great price and good performance.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little machine
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little machine. I am running debian on it. I have a plex media server and a Minecraft server running simultaneously and I can connect to it from anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can also run Bunsen Labs Linux (Debian based) just fine for text editing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to run OpenElec ( It runs perfectly straight from a USB thumbdrive and can output to 4K via miniDP port. I can also run Bunsen Labs Linux (Debian based) just fine for text editing, coding...no heavy c compiling... In general, it's a good box if you need 4K output straight out of the box with Linux (NUC i3-4010U doesn't seem to support that well, flickering and all).
customer_reviews.author: Tuan Trung Pham

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to build a small PC with a large capacity 2.5” SSD and it works well. Added Crucial 2x2GB and a wireless keyboard/mouse. Contrary to some reviews on the web, it does boot fine from the 2.5” SSD. Fast 802.11ac is built-in. Update: Windows 10 upgrade went smoothly (with USB drive downloaded from Microsoft) and the PC still works well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my TV Nice audio preamp too
customer_reviews.text: Still works as of today, and with only a spinning HD! Perfect for my TV Nice audio preamp too...
customer_reviews.author: Paull Loudspeakers

customer_reviews.title: Good, not Great
customer_reviews.text: A little slow as (stutters, slower boot) with 8GB and 240GB SSD. for around $300 fully quipped with Windows 10, it's a formidable daily task PC.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great tiny PC, but get me into Blue Screen
customer_reviews.text: For just $150 you got a tiny PC for office work and home entertainment, also with customizable config. I install adata 8GB ram, plextor 120GB SSD and 500GB HDD for mass storage. However, I got BSOD Driver Power State Failure error when I update the Windows, or just a simple reboot. I guess Windows 10 is not compatible then I try Windows 8.1 and runs smoothly. Once again when I tried to upgrade the OS, it took a long time and suddenly blue screen again!!! I reset it and still waiting to load into the windows 😬 I have spent a few days but still can't figure a solution, thinking to return the device...
customer_reviews.author: David Lo

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: These little things work great. Very happy with performance. It's being used in an office where we wanted a minimal footprint. Have it hooked to dual 27" LED monitors and running Windows 10 Pro. Great little machine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Nicely done adding an option for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Nicely done adding an option for a 2.5" SATA drive without increasing the size of the unit for people wanting to stick to mSATA. Runs extremely well, is quiet, looks good and has only minor annoyances, i.e. it's a tiny bit fiddly putting it back together (it's not hard, but it doesn't just fall back into place) and the power led is excessively bright. That said, I can only recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bernd Groh

customer_reviews.title: perfect replacement to my 6 year old vaio whose display ...
customer_reviews.text: perfect replacement to my 6 year old vaio whose display has bombed and became a desktop. quieter, faster and more efficient. I initially tried to use the DDR3 ram of my vaio. but it didnt post as apparently, 4th gen onwards, low powered cpus need 1.35v rams as opposed to 1.5v used traditionally. some people reported that only a few rams worked while other dont. for me, all of the 1.35 ones worked. I tried 3 8gb modules. kingston, samsung, transcend. all of them worked at first try. hope it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: reliable but a bit slow, still a great value
customer_reviews.text: This has been running Linux 24/7 as a media server since I got it and popped in a 4GB ram module. Its a bit slow, but I knew that going in. Next time I'd opt for at least an i3.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: It is a bare bones unit, as advertised, ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a bare bones unit, as advertised, with no OS. As it was my first bare bones build I initially struggled with getting the OS on but did figure out the unit I was building the bootable USB from was the problem. So far the unit is up on Windows 10 Pro and is exceeding my expectations. If given the opportunity I would purchase this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: It has better wifi and more storage options than the pi though
customer_reviews.text: Not quite powerful enough to emulate ps1 games when running lakka. A raspberry pi 3 outperforms it on several titles. It has better wifi and more storage options than the pi though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Equipped with 16 gigs of ram, a fast 400 ...
customer_reviews.text: Equipped with 16 gigs of ram, a fast 400 gig ssd and a 1 tera hard disk, this thing absolutely screams.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a Light-use Windows 10 Desktop.
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine. I added an SSD and 4gb of RAM for short change to replace a family member's aging PC. The machine exceeded expectations -- it runs Windows 10 well, and handles web browsing, email, video, and light gaming like a champ. Highly recommended for similar purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: ... a gift that is working perfectly and is actually better than the compute stick in the emulator category
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift that is working perfectly and is actually better than the compute stick in the emulator category
customer_reviews.author: Deirkson Maduro

customer_reviews.title: Small PC without an even smaller electric consumption footprint. ...
customer_reviews.text: Small PC without an even smaller electric consumption footprint. MSI designed this well by including an option for the user to swap the base to accommodate for 2.5" drives instead of having to stick to the smaller and costlier drives
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they are perfect for its intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Solid build quality. I already bought three of these, they are perfect for its intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Pons B.

customer_reviews.title: Quick fix
customer_reviews.text: If your Cubi won't power up at first just clear the bios using the jumpers to the right of the RAM slots. I thought my unit was DOA but after clearing the bios it fired right up.
customer_reviews.author: tothv

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. I loaded it with 8GB of HyperX ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I loaded it with 8GB of HyperX RAM and a ssd. Works really good with windows 10. Pretty snappy for a budget processor.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Check ram compabilty
customer_reviews.text: Excellent computer if you know what you buy. But check ram compability in the MSI page I had a little troble finding one that can be use. I had tried 5 different rams before finding one that works
customer_reviews.author: santiago

customer_reviews.title: Great concept. Well executed.
customer_reviews.text: Love this device! It's small, uses little power and is plenty fast for most tasks. For the price, it's really hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Jolla

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice unit, however had one with failed display port, but tech support has been good so far
customer_reviews.author: Avi L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little PC, I use them on 55' TV and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Yazdian

customer_reviews.title: Junk junk junk. Did mention it's a piece of junk?
customer_reviews.text: I build mini PCS for my clients and decided t would be neat to try something other than a NUC so I ordered a cubi. Mainly cause I liked the way it looked. Well I received it yesterday and am Sending it right back. Would power up but won't boot. Yes I had ram and disk installed. There seems to be a lot of this going on with mini PC barebones systems. Btw ive never once had any issues with a NUC.
customer_reviews.author: Dimitri

customer_reviews.title: Probably good, but compatible memory is not specified.
customer_reviews.text: Memory is a big issue. The above link is the memory I purchased, and it doesn't boot. Can't find specific memory that definitely works. Update 12/22 Tried the  Also no luck. Not posting at all.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: A desktop replacement for 90% of users.
customer_reviews.text: I was always planning on building a home theater PC, but never got around to it. This little thing is it. It runs Windows 10 perfectly (and ran 8 as well) and does most of what you need a computer to do. It's silent, tiny, and a definite conversation starter. And, although some people dispute it, mine ran with a 2.5" SSD perfectly. For the money, it's a blast!
customer_reviews.author: J. Karczmit

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Intel Guts for $150
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it is pretty amazing. High quality Intel chipset, on board video and wireless card. Gigabit NIC and USB 3.0 for $150...this is a no brainier. Added a leftover SSD, RAM and laptop hard drive I had laying around and installed Windows 7 all with no hitch. Made for a great HTPC for my daughters room.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: I guess it would be good if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Read good reviews about this unit, was very excited to mount it to my living room TV for netflix/media streaming. Ended up DOA, I tried three different kits of RAM on it and nothing would get it to POST. It turned on, fan spun at full speed and nothing much else happened. I suppose it would be good if it worked, but I'm not trying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Media Client.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Loaded Windows 8.1 then Windows 10. No complaints at all. Quiet,Cool, perfect media client (using Sage TV). Will probably buy a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: sconcin

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Look at all the low reviews, everything they say is true. Sent it back. Buy a Gigabyte or Asus.
customer_reviews.author: Wingback43

customer_reviews.title: Check the BIOS for a specific version of Microsoft Windows.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Size Silent fan Cons: I got a this unit with a BIOS version 120 and could only install Windows 7. If you want to install Windows 8+ you'll need a BIOS version 840. I went to their support page to flash my BIOS with no success. Their instructions are confusing.
customer_reviews.author: marcpro7

customer_reviews.title: Not as good performance wise as I thought
customer_reviews.text: Not as good performance wise as I thought, I thought once I installed my 64bit operating system I could add more memory but it's locked at 8Mb., gets bogged down pretty quick. It does serve the main reason I bought it for and that is to conserve energy, I wanted to use it with an LED monitor and the small draw on energy from this. Great that way, just wish I could increase the memory, maybe they will come out with a bios update that will enable me to do it.
customer_reviews.author: D_Man3

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it - it is small, fast and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: djdelisle

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: THe manufacturer does NOT define what is required for RAM and Storage and thus has caused me grief and add'l costs to get the functionality I expected from this unit. Oh, it works VERY well. but only accepts the 42mm m.2 SSD drive (which is found nowhere except via their Techs) and also requires DUAL SODIMMS to get dual monitor support which is also only know by their Techs. Amazon is great as always about this stuff but MSI and ASUS have both got issues with telling the whole story about their new all in one products.
customer_reviews.author: G. Clements

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't worth the effort.  never got it working.
customer_reviews.text: Never got it working. Not needed anymore. Sits in my desk drawer. Support was somewhat helpful but after changing bois settings still could not get OS to load. Not as easy to use as other brands I worked with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: This device is extremely picky about the brand of RAM you use. I bought standard RAM that fits the criteria (DDR3L-1600 SODIMM, 1.35v) and it would not even post. This is quality Crucial branded RAM, not some flaky cheap stuff. I pulled the RAM from my working Intel NUC in tried it. Same problem. I went to the MSI forums and found people having the same issue. There's a reason for memory standards, and apparently MSI doesn't care to follow them.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Worsest hardware support. First and last time I have tried MSI products.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work out of the box. I installed 2 memory bars which were advised from one of the reviews there, and still, I could not run it at all. Blank black screen, it's only what I got, no bios info, nothing.. Went with an intel nuc, a little higher price, but better configuration, and no worries of hardware incompatibility. Worsest hardware support. First and last time I have tried MSI products.
customer_reviews.author: Raccoon Humorist

customer_reviews.title: They denied my rebate saying I didn't include a copy ...
customer_reviews.text: They denied my rebate saying I didn't include a copy of my receipt though I included a copy of my amazon.com receipt. I will never buy another MSI product again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not work
customer_reviews.text: I have black screen only is not work . i trayed to instold win 10 but noting respond just black screen
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Alraja

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I just got my MSI Cubi yesterday. I have to say that I was really disappointed because it didn't come with certain components: mSata SSD, memory ram card, HDMI cable, and an OS for it. It's like building your own desktop. I could've bought a new PC desktop for $200 without spending more money on these components, and each of them total cost around $200+ bucks.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Waiting a little longer for integrated graphics with HDMI 2.0.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for HDMI 2.0 but it only has HDMI 1.4. Top ram slot is a little tricky and bottom cover takes some extra effort to slip around some small tabs on the inner components. It was much smaller than I expected, though it's not as small or cheap as the atom compute stick, but it's more quiet and more capable.
customer_reviews.author: dj BEER

product_meta.title: Cubi 2 Intel Kaby Lake Core i7-7500U DDR4 mSATA HDMI Wifi Bluetooth SFF Barebone PC (Cubi2-005BUS)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Cubi2-005BUSMSI proudly announces its latest and smallest mini-PC to date: the MSI Cubi 2. This tiny desktop is built on a concept of nifty technology and a brilliant design to suit the needs of both consumers and businesses. Cubi 2 is design with the latest Intel kabylake-u power saving processors. Users can benefit from a powerful handheld-size PC capable of carrying multiple modular hard disks that provide a large base for data storage. Cubi 2 is mountable to a wall by VESA standards or can be combined with an HDTV, so the user can enjoy Ultra high-definition and High quality media entertainment at home. With plenty of ports to connect to external devices, Cubi 2 is the essence of small, Smart computing.
feature_bullets: Vesa-mount bracket included;Memory (GB):DDR4-2133 S0-DIMM x2 Slots, 32GB Max (not Included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars134 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
